IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE COLLEGEVILLE INSTITUTE IS A PLACE OF SCHOLARSHIP, WORSHIP, DIALOGUE, AND COMMUNITY IMMERSED IN THE BENEDICTINE RHYTHM OF WORK AND PRAYER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE COLLEGEVILLE INSTITUTE, ROOTED IN CHRISTIAN TRADITION, BRINGS TOGETHER PEOPLE OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS AND PERSPECTIVES TO FOSTER THE WORLD'S HEALING THROUGH THE POWER OF RELIGIOUS IDEAS, INSIGHT, AND PRACTICES.
IRS990.Desc: CALLED TO LIVES OF MEANING AND PURPOSE INITIATIVE: IN THE COORDINATION'S FIFTH YEAR, OUR TEAM FOCUSED ON PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR GRANTEES AND OPERATIONAL SUPPORT FOR ENDOWMENT PROGRAM STAFF, OVERSEEING THE RESEARCH PROJECT AND SUPPORTING THE CREATION OF RESOURCES FOR GRANTEES AND THEIR CONGREGATIONS. WE ARE CURRENTLY WORKING WITH 13 ORGANIZATIONS WHO ARE SUPPORTING APPROXIMATELY 250 CONGREGATIONS REPRESENTING 36 STATES AND THREE CANADIAN PROVINCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ECCLESIAL LITERATURE PROJECT SEEKS TO STRENGTHEN PASTORAL LEADERSHIP IN MAINLINE AND MODERATE EVANGELICAL CHURCHES BY ENCOURAGING PASTORS, MEMBERS OF PASTORS' CONGREGATIONS, AND OTHERS WRITING ABOUT THE LIFE OF THE FAITH TO REACH A BROAD AUDIENCE THROUGH SERIOUS RELIGIOUS WRITING. IN GENERAL, WE INTEND TO HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE QUALITY OF THE SPIRITUAL AND INTELLECTUAL LIFE OF CONGREGATIONS THROUGH THEIR LEADER'S PARTICIPATION IN A WRITING PROGRAM. WE AIM TO FURTHER THE ROLE THAT WRITING PLAYS IN THE CHRISTIAN LIFE BY PROVIDING DIRECT SUPPORT TO PARTICIPANTS, WHICH WILL STRENGTHEN THEIR WRITING AND HELP THEM COMMUNICATE MORE EFFECTIVELY IN THE PUBLIC SQUARE. IN 2022, WE HOSTED 5 WRITING WORKSHOPS, CLOSED-OUT THE EMERGING WRITERS MENTORSHIP PROGRAM COHORT 2, LAUNCHED EMERGING WRITERS MENTORSHIP PROGRAM COHORT 3, AND SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASED OUR LEADERS AND PARTICIPANTS OF COLOR.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COMMUNITIES OF CALLING INITIATIVE'S GOAL AND PURPOSE CONTINUES TO BE: SUPPORT 13 CONGREGATIONS AS THEY BECOME COMMUNITIES OF CALLING WHO ENGAGE VOCATION IN THEIR WORSHIP LIFE, THROUGH THEOLOGICAL STUDY, AND IN CONVERSATION WITH AND SERVICE TO THEIR NEIGHBORS. ENCOURAGE AND SUPPORT A VIBRANT ECUMENICAL LEARNING COMMUNITY AMONG THE CONGREGATIONS THAT MODELS HOW FOCUSING ON VOCATION, BOTH INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNAL, REVITALIZES THE LOCAL CHURCH FOR ITS MISSION IN THE WORLD. TOGETHER WITH THE CONGREGATIONS, TO CREATE VARIED RESOURCES ON VOCATION THAT ARE CONTEXTUALLY APPROPRIATE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: THE COLLEGEVILLE INSTITUTE WELCOMES SCHOLARS, CLERGY, CHURCH LEADERS, THINKERS, ARTISTS, AND WRITERS FROM AROUND THE WORLD SEEKING TO DISCERN AND COMMUNICATE THE MEANING OF CHRISTIAN IDENTITY AND UNITY IN A RELIGIOUSLY AND CULTURALLY DIVERSE WORLD. WELL-TRAINED, CREATIVE, ARTICULATE WOMEN AND MEN GATHER FOR ONE OR TWO SEMESTERS FOR CAREFUL THOUGHT IN A PLACE OF INQUIRY AND PRAYER, ENGAGING IN INDEPENDENT STUDY WITHIN A COMMUNITY SETTING.

SupportedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SIS OF THE ORDER OF ST BEN

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART I, ITEM G (VII)
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE ORDER PROVIDES A NUMBER OF SERVICES THAT SUPPORT THE WORK OF THE INSTITUTE. THESE INCLUDE ACCOUNTING, PAYROLL, UTILITIES, FIRE SAFETY, AND ACCESS TO CAMPUS RESOURCES, SPACE, AND PERSONNEL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INSTITUTE'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO BE USED TO FUND INSTITUTE PROGRAM INITIATIVES AND SUPPORT THE INSTITUTE'S OPERATING BUDGET. 5% OF THE ANNUAL DRAW IS USED TO SUPPORT THE OVERALL MISSION OF THE INSTITUTE. BOARD DESIGNATED PORTION CURRENTLY SUPPORTS CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS.

THE INSTITUTE IS CLASSIFIED AS A TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) AND IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE INSTITUTE IS ALSO EXEMPT FROM MINNESOTA TAXES UNDER MINNESOTA STATUTE CHAPTER 290.05. THEREFORE, CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE INSTITUTE ARE CONSIDERED TAX DEDUCTIBLE. THE INSTITUTE FILES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION, SHOULD THAT STATUS BE CHALLENGED IN THE FUTURE, ALL YEARS SINCE INCEPTION WOULD BE SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF SIX TO EIGHT MEMBERS, ALL PART OF THE GOVERNING BODY EACH WITH A VOTE: THE CHAIR AND VICE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE CHAIRS OF ALL OTHER BOARD COMMITTEES AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE COMMITTEE IS CHAIRED BY THE BOARD CHAIR. A QUORUM IS A MAJORITY OF EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBERS CURRENTLY IN OFFICE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE HAS THE AUTHORITY TO TAKE ACTION ON EMERGENCY MATTERS THAT CANNOT OR SHOULD NOT BE DEFERRED TO THE BOARD'S NEXT SCHEDULED MEETING AND THAT WILL HELP THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MAKE NEEDED BUSINESS DECISIONS BETWEEN REGULAR BOARD MEETINGS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ALONE SHALL HAVE THE POWER TO AWARD PROMOTIONS AND LEAVES OF ABSENCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EX OFFICIO MEMBERS CAN ELECT THEIR DELEGATES TO THE BOARD IN THEIR ABSENCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS VIA EMAIL ALONG WITH A REQUEST TO REVIEW AND THEN WE ASK FOR APPROVAL. THE APPROVAL IS ASKED FOR BY EMAIL, OR A LIVE VOTE AT THE FALL BOARD MEETING WHICH IS HELD IN-PERSON. AN UNANIMOUS VOTE IS REQUIRED BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT THE ANNUAL BOARD MEETING IN THE SPRING, BOARD MEMBERS ARE PROVIDED WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, THEY ARE ASKED TO READ, COMPLETE AND SIGN. ANY CONFLICTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD RELATIONS COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO THE APPROVAL OF EACH ANNUAL BUDGET, THE CI PERSONNEL COMMITTEE REVIEWS EMPLOYEES AND PERFORMANCE. IN CONSULTATION WITH THE SAINT JOHN'S ABBEY HUMAN RESOURCE DEPARTMENT, COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND COMPARED TO MARKET PRICING OF EACH POSITION. THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE FULL BOARD AS PART OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET APPROVAL PROCESS. THE PROCESS DESCRIBED HERE WAS LAST COMPLETED IN 2023

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: BENEDICTINES IN SERVICE TO THE CHURCH AND THE WORLD

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SISTERS OF THE ORDER OF ST BENEDICT

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: INSTITUTE OF ROMAN CATHOLIC WOMEN DEDICATED TO THE SERVICE OF GOD
